summary:
Atopic dermatitis, or eczema, is a long-lasting skin condition causing itchy, red, and swollen skin. It often starts in childhood and can change in severity over time. Many people outgrow it. The cause is unknown, but genetics and environment play a role. It's not contagious.

Treatment focuses on skin care, avoiding triggers, and using creams to reduce inflammation. Antihistamines can help with itching. Severe cases may require stronger medications. Eczema can't be cured, but proper care can manage symptoms.
title: Atopic dermatitis
